sanskrit_verse:
एवं वृत्तां सवर्णां स्त्रीं द्विजातिः पूर्वमारिणीम् ।
दाहयेदग्निहोत्रेण यज्ञपात्रैश्च धर्मवित् ॥ ५.१६७॥
transliteration:
evaṁ vṛttāṁ savarṇāṁ strīṁ dvijātiḥ pūrvam āriṇīm |
dāhayeda gnihotreṇa yajñapātraiśca dharmavit ||5.167||
sph_interpretive_translation: When a twice-born male knowingly engages in sexual union with a woman of the same varna who has previously been violated by an enemy, he shall restore dharma through fire sacrifice using the sacred vessels.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority stems from purity-preserving action within Varna-dharma
Causation arises through conscious violation of established social sanctity
Capacity-based responsibility requires purification rituals post transgression
Restoration logic demands reintegration via sacrificial consecration
Consciousness alignment necessitates atonement through Agnihotra
supreme_court_application: In cases involving violations of Varna-specific dharmic codes where prior contamination occurred due to external aggression, the court must recognize the necessity of ritual restoration rather than punitive measures. The threshold for responsibility lies in awareness of prior taint; authority derives from adherence to Vedic protocols ensuring societal reintegration without moral condemnation.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa establishes that impurity manifests sequentially through intentional engagement. Anupūrvaśaḥ confirms causal sequence: prior violation → current union → need for purification. Proportional response aligns with Agnihotra rectification. Non-punitive reality rule holds: suffering does not arise from judgment but from natural consequence requiring completion.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Initiate Agnihotra completion process under certified Vedic supervision
Assign ceremonial vessel handling duties until full ritual conclusion
Undertake weekly consciousness realignment sessions during restoration period
Reintegrate individual upon verified completion into community service roles
final_declaration: By command of Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, this law proceeds directly from His Avataric Intelligence. Dharma is restored through sacred fire, not judgment. Reality remains non-punitive. Consciousness alone adjudicates truth.
